{"step_by_step_thinking": "Actinomycin D is an antibiotic that binds to DNA and inhibits RNA synthesis, it is not a monoclonal antibody. Therefore, statement A is not true. Actinomycin D is not cell-specific, but it is cell cycle-specific, so statement B is true. Vinblastine is a chemotherapy medication that works by stopping the cancer cells from separating into two new cells, so it's not cell-specific but it is cell cycle-specific, so statement C is true.", "answer_choice": "A"}
